Package com.mathmaster13.fynotek

Class FynotekWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mathmaster13.fynotek.FynotekParent
      • com.mathmaster13.fynotek.FynotekWord
  • public class FynotekWord
extends FynotekParent
    A class for handling words in Fynotek, a conlang by mochaspen. All objects created by this class are immutable. Fynotek documentarion can be found here.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_MAGNITUDE

        public static final java.math.BigInteger MAX_MAGNITUDE
        The maximum integer supported by Fynotek's number system. You can compare if a number x is too large or small with (x.abs().compareTo(MAX_MAGNITUDE) > 0).
        See Also:
        number(BigInteger)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FynotekWord

        public FynotekWord​(java.lang.String word,
                   boolean isProper)
        Converts a String and a boolean into a FynotekWord. The String contains the word itself, while the boolean represents whether the word is a proper noun: true if it is, and false if it is not. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on word).
        Parameters:
        word - word to be converted to a FynotekWord.
        isProper - whether the word is a proper noun or not.

      • FynotekWord

        public FynotekWord​(java.lang.String word)
        Converts a String into a FynotekWord. The word is assumed not to be a proper noun. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on word).
        Parameters:
        word - word to be converted to a FynotekWord.

      • nounCase

        public FynotekWord nounCase​(char caseOfNoun)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the noun case specified by caseOfNoun. caseOfNoun should be either 'n' (nominative), 'a' (accusative), 'g' (genitive), or 'd' (dative). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned. There is also a special case for the word "folo", which is irregular.
        Parameters:
        caseOfNoun - the noun case to inflect this FynotekWord for.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the specified noun case.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekParent)

      • verbTense

        public FynotekWord verbTense​(char tenseOfVerb,
                             boolean hypothetical)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the verb tense (if this word is not a proper noun) or verb modifier form (if this word is a proper noun) specified by tenseOfVerb. tenseOfVerb should be either 'p' (present), 'a' (past), 'f' (future), or 'g' (gnomic). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned. If hypothetical is set to true, the word will be marked for a hypothetical tense; otherwise, the word will be inflected for a non-hypothetical tense.
        Overrides:
        verbTense in class FynotekParent
        Parameters:
        tenseOfVerb - the verb tense to inflect this FynotekWord for.
        hypothetical - whether this word should be inflected for a hypothetical tense or not.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the specified verb tense.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekParent), FynotekParent.verbTense(char, boolean)

      • verbTense

        public FynotekWord verbTense​(char tenseOfVerb)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the non-hypothetical verb tense specified by tenseOfVerb. tenseOfVerb should be either 'p' (present), 'a' (past), 'f' (future), or 'g' (gnomic). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned.
        Overrides:
        verbTense in class FynotekParent
        Parameters:
        tenseOfVerb - the verb tense to inflect this FynotekWord for.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the specified verb tense.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekParent)

      • suffix

        public FynotekWord suffix​(java.lang.String suffix)
        Returns a FynotekWord with the specified suffix appended to the end of this word. If the suffix creates a phonotactically invalid sequence, n or a will be infixed as needed to make the resulting word phonotactically valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on suffix).
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix to be appended to the end of this FynotekWord.
        Returns:
        a FynotekWord with the specified suffix appended to the end of it.
        See Also:
        prefix(String)

      • prefix

        public FynotekWord prefix​(java.lang.String prefix)
        Returns a FynotekWord with the specified prefix appended to the beginning of this word. If the prefix creates a phonotactically invalid sequence, n or a will be infixed as needed to make the resulting word phonotactically valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called in the suffix method).
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix to be appended to the beginning of this FynotekWord.
        Returns:
        a FynotekWord with the specified prefix appended to the beginning of it.
        See Also:
        suffix(String)

      • match

        public FynotekWord match​(FynotekParent word)

        Overrides:
        match in class FynotekParent
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the same case or tense as word.
        See Also:

      • isMarked

        public boolean isMarked()
        Description copied from class: FynotekParent
        Returns whether this FynotekParent is marked or not. Specifically, returns (markVowel != '␀'). Be careful: this means that non-hypothetical present-tense verbs will return false, and in FynotekWord specifically nominative-case nouns will also return false, and "folo" in the accusative case (if "folo" is not a proper noun) will return true.
        Overrides:
        isMarked in class FynotekParent
        Returns:
        true if this FynotekParent has been marked by ablaut or a proper noun suffix, and false if it has not been.
        See Also:
        FynotekParent.markVowel

      • isProper

        public boolean isProper()
        Returns whether this FynotekWord is a proper noun or not. Specifically, this returns true if this word is a proper noun, and false if it is not.
        Returns:
        whether this FynotekWord is a proper noun or not.
        See Also:
        FynotekWord(String, boolean)

      • personSuffix

        public FynotekWord personSuffix​(int person)
        Description copied from class: FynotekParent
        Returns this word with a suffix added to mark the first, second, or third person.
        Specified by:
        personSuffix in class FynotekParent
        Parameters:
        person - the person to mark this word for. Can only be 1, 2, or 3.
        Returns:
        this word with a suffix added to mark the first, second, or third person.
        See Also:
        FynotekParent.verbTense(char, boolean)

      • number

        public static java.lang.String number​(java.math.BigInteger num)
        Returns the Fynotek translation of the specified number. If the number's absolute value is greater than MAX_MAGNITUDE, an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to be translated.
        Returns:
        the Fynotek translation of the specified number.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number provided is too large for the number system to handle.
        See Also:
        MAX_MAGNITUDE

      • number

        public static java.lang.String number​(long num)
        Returns the Fynotek translation of the specified number.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to be translated.
        Returns:
        the Fynotek translation of the specified number.

      • isValidSequence

        public static boolean isValidSequence​(java.lang.String sequence)
        Returns whether the given sequence is phonotactically and orthographically valid in Fynotek. Capitalization is ignored (for example, "A" and "a" are treated the same way). Multiple words can be separated by whitespace, and this function will only return true if all words in sequence are valid. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored (the String.trim() method is called on sequence). A sequence containing punctuation marks, numbers, or other non-letter characters returns false, as well as an empty sequence or one containing only whitespace.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to be checked for validity.
        Returns:
        true if sequence is a valid sequence, and false if otherwise.
